thread.title: Tanks keep winning, place first twice in Unioto Invite
thread.title_full: Tanks keep winning, place first twice in Unioto Invite

title: Tanks keep winning, place first twice in Unioto Invite
text:
Tanks keep winning, place first twice in Unioto Invite Derrick Webb , Reporter 10:30 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Unioto's Haley Wright crosses the finish line, Saturday morning, during the Unioto Invitational. Wright won her event and broke a school record first set by former Sherman, Kinkela Harkins. (Photo: Andrew MacLachlan/For the Gazette) Story Highlights Both Unioto's boys and girls cross country teams took home first place finishes, Saturday morning. Junior Haley Wright broke the previous school record, individually, and won her event at 18:11.10. David Magda won the boys event, individually, with a mark of 15:35.0, 11 seconds off a record. 11 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CHILLICOTHE — At its own cross country invitational, Unioto represented itself in the best way possible Saturday morning, with two wins in a field of 30 different schools. 
Both the Tanks boys and girls team took first place in their races and had individual first place finishers as well in events that featured a total of 245 and 184 runners, respectively. 
On the boys side, senior David Magda continued a magnificent season, taking first overall with a mark of 15:35.0. The win for Magda was 11 seconds off the school record, set by Adrian Ross. 
Sophomore Cole Clever also had a good day, finishing fifth overall with a time of 16:05.40 – good enough to tie former Sherman and Shawnee State All-American Galen Dills on Unioto’s all-time sophomore list. 
Also scoring for the Shermans was freshman Aaron Laplante (13th, 16:41.90), freshman Tucker Markko (14th, 16:44.40) and freshman Jaden Watkins (23rd, 16:56.70), rounding out the top five. 
Those performances gave Unioto the win as a team as well, with 56 total points and an average finish time of 16:24.68 – setting a new school record, edging the 2010 team who were regional champs. 
Seven other area teams were also in the event: Waverly, Zane Trace, Westfall, Chillicothe, Huntington, Adena and Paint Valley. 
Waverly finished in sixth place with 206 points with Hunter Hoover as its top individual finisher. He was eighth with a time of 16:32.70. The next closest Tiger to Hoover was Brenden Reed, in 30th, with a mark of 17:15.0. 
Zane Trace finished in seventh place with 227 points. The Pioneers’ best individual finish came from sophomore Andrew Graves, who came in 16th with a time of 16:48.60. 
After Zane Trace was Westfall (9th, 250 points), Chillicothe (13th, 336 points), Huntington (14th, 351 points), Paint Valley (21st, 554 points) and Adena (23rd, 695 points). 
As good as the Shermans boys were, the girls were even better. Unioto’s top five individual finishers all crossed the finish line as a part of the top 25. 
Per usual, junior Haley Wright led the way with a first place finish. However, this one was different than the others she’s turned in this year. 
Wright shattered the school record, held by Kinkela Harkins, by 40 seconds with a time of 18:11.10 — 20 seconds faster than her closest competitor. Her closest competitor happened to be her own teammate in sophomore Alex Evans, who took second with a mark of 18:31.30. 
Elena Knipp followed those two with an eight place individual finish at 19:07.50 and was proceeded by freshman Tessa Sylvester, in ninth, at 19:10.60. Rounding out the Tanks’ top five was freshman Abbey Mohan in 23rd with a finish time of 20:19.60, a personal record. 
To further explain the dominance Unioto put forth Saturday; Amber Butler began the day at second all-time in school history. When the day ended, she was sixth. 
The Shermans’ mark of 41 points also gave them the team win and kept their unbeaten streak alive in Division II this season. 
Zane Trace’s girls also had a good day on the course, coming in third as a team with 154 points. 
Scoring for the Pioneers were junior Ivy Beam (17th, 19:55.40), senior Alison Chinn (22nd, 20:16.80), junior McKenzie Ray (35th, 20:58.70), sophomore Hailey Puckett (38th, 21:04.10) and sophomore Taylor Fletchner (61st, 21:58.10). 
Waverly’s Jamie Welch (10th, 19:13.30) powered the Tigers to a fourth place team finish with 169 points. 
Also in the area was Westfall (5th, 201 points), Chillicothe (14th, 327 points), Adena (18th, 395 points), Huntington (19th, 464 points) and Paint Valley (20th, 546 points).
